name: Nis
fun_fact: Fun fact: Ni코 is the birthplace of Constantine the Great, the Roman Emperor who legalized Christianity and founded Constantinople. But the city's most haunting monument is the Skull Tower - built by Ottomans in 1809 from 952 skulls of Serbian rebels. Today, 58 skulls remain embedded in its walls, and in 2024, anthropologists began forensic reconstruction of their faces

signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Always served at the start of meals in small glasses. Homemade rakija is a point of family pride - every Serbian has an uncle who makes 'the best.' Never refuse when offered, it's insulting. Toast with '콯iveli!' (Cheers!). Follow immediately with food or you'll regret it

The Skull Tower draws 30,000 visitors yearly and is considered a pilgrimage site for Serbs, symbolizing resistance against Ottoman rule
Kafana culture is strong - traditional taverns with live music, grilled meats, and rakija flowing freely
